topic.title: Zero Private - share encrypted text and files

1_1EywVvJxujocAAMuS1zMcRs4JQJktQbWa9.body:
@nofish I missed that step in the tutorial, thanks. It's now been fixed and re-published.

Any idea how I can test as a new user? I've opened the site in another browser, but I'm still logged in as the same user.
@nippletwister @dman I think the problem happens if you post without logging in. Now it will request you login if you are not. File drag'n'drop will fail if not logged in currently.

I can't seem to find a way to logout after logging in, even from code, so I can't test the logging in part. I have however changed the green button to have the text "Encrypt (logged in)" if you are logged in, and "Login" if you are not logged in. If someone could provide feedback on what it shows for you, and what happens when you click it that would help.

I also seem to get one of these two errors when writing the files, but it seems to write and store them correctly anyway:

"Content sign failed: invalid private key."

"Internal error: TypeError: 'bool' object has no attribute '__getitem__'
UiWebsocket.py line 98 > UiWebsocket.py line 174 > UiWebsocket.py line 311 > UiWebsocket.py line 277"
